derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French temptacion, from Latin temptatio(n-), from temptare 'handle, test, try'

encyclopedia.content: n. 1. 诱惑， 引诱2. 诱惑物， 煽诱人的事物 1. 诱惑，引诱 temporary暂时的，临别的 temporary workers...temptation诱惑，引诱。..terror恐怖bbs 2. 诱惑 涉及的并不仅是坚决的“意志力”（willpower），或抗拒“诱惑”（temptation）；而是寻找一种方法改变心智的内容与联想（associations），...finance. 3. 引诱，诱惑物，魔道 temporarily ad.暂时地，临时地。..temptation n.引诱，诱惑物，魔道。..tent n.帐篷，寓所，住

entry.def: If you feel you want to do something or have something, even though you know you really should avoid it, you can refer to this feeling as temptation. You can also refer to the thing you want to do or have as a temptation .

example.ex: Will they be able to resist the temptation to buy?
example.tran: 他们能忍住诱惑不买吗？

example.ex: ...the many temptations to which you will be exposed.

means.word_mean: 1. something that seduces or has the quality to seduce
2. the desire to have or do something that you know you should avoid;

sentences.sentence: "he felt the temptation and his will power weakened"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of influencing by exciting hope or desire;

auth_sentence.content: But there are good reasons for avoiding that temptation.
auth_sentence.res_content: But there are good reasons for avoiding that temptation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But there are good reasons for avoiding that temptation.

auth_sentence.content: Resist the temptation to go too big too fast.
auth_sentence.res_content: Resist the temptation to go too big too fast.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Resist the temptation to go too big too fast.

auth_sentence.content: Betrayal and temptation happen; inner doubts do not.
auth_sentence.res_content: Betrayal and temptation happen; inner doubts do not.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Betrayal and temptation happen; inner doubts do not.

stems_affixes.word_buile: contempt[n.轻视,藐视;受辱,丢脸]+ible..的→adj.令人轻视的
contempt[n.轻视,藐视;受辱,丢脸]+uous……的→adj.表示轻蔑的,藐视的
tempt[v.诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣]+atious→adj.诱惑性的
at一再+tempt尝试→一再尝试→企图
con共同+tempt尝试→大家都能试下→没什么了不起→轻视,藐视
tempt[v.诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣]+ation表名词→n.引诱,诱惑;诱惑物
at一再+tempt尝试→一再尝试→企图
con共同+temn=tempt尝试→大家都能试下→没什么了不起→蔑视

stems_affixes.value_cn: 诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣
stems_affixes.word_buile: tempt尝试→v.诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣

Sentence.sentence: Its temptation is too strong for people to resist.
Large companies have a difficult time switching into new markets because there is a temptation to put existing assets into the new businesses
Although many other big firms resisted the temptation to over-borrow, developers borrowed heavily and built bigger and fancier hotels as if the whole world were planning a holiday in Las Vegas.

kd.EN: fall into/give way to/yield to temptation

Sentence.sentence: So the temptation is to write and rewrite and rewrite.
They are better sheltered from all the outside temptations.
He can't resist the temptation of TV either.

means.word_mean: 诱惑物, 煽诱人的事物

sentences.en: The purse on the table was a strong temptation to the poor child.
sentences.cn: 桌上的钱包对那个穷孩子是一个强烈的诱惑。

jushi.english: I tried to overcome the temptation to laugh.
The sight of the purse on the table was a strong temptation to the poor child.
jushi.chinese: 桌上的钱包对那个穷孩子是一个强烈的诱惑。
